trans-unit.source: Represents a name and value pair used to correlate messages to specific receiving activities.
<xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.CorrelationProperty> classes are defined as <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityBind> properties of Workflow Connection Service activities.
By default, these properties are bound to variables declared at the root workflow activity.

For dynamic activities such as <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ReplicatorActivity> and <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ConditionedActivityGroup> each of its children cannot share a universal <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.CorrelationProperty> object.
Consider the scenario where each task inside a <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ReplicatorActivity> has to manage its own conversation.
The child activities inside the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ReplicatorActivity> requires a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.CorrelationProperty> instance unique per execution context, or per task.

In order to accomplish this, you have to define a custom activity that has a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.CorrelationProperty> instance property and the Workflow Connection Services activities have to bind to this property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Runtime.CorrelationProperty"></xref> class.
The name of the property used in the correlation set.
The value of the correlation set property.
name is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Gets the name of the property used in the correlation set.
The name of the property used in the correlation set.
Gets the value of the correlation set property.
The value of the correlation set property.
